title: How To Beat The Winter Blues
summary: Winter blues are common among many people, and there’s a way to beat them. Eating a balanced diet high in fruits and vegetables will help to boost your mood. Light therapy is a great way to treat the winter blues. Try to stay as active as you can, even if it means squeezing in shorter workouts. Take care of yourself, meditate, book a massage, or find other ways to relax and destress. Surround yourself with friends as much as possible. Get together with old friends, meet up with new friends, or take a trip somewhere to visit friends you haven’t seen in a while.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The winter blues is a mood disorder that can affect anyone, not just people from northern regions. Symptoms of the winter blues are essentially SAD (seasonal affective disorder) brought on by the shorter days and colder temperatures of winter. If you find yourself feeling blue during the colder months but don\u2019t necessarily have a reason to be, you might have the winter blues. The good news is that you can combat this feeling with a little help from your friends and some lifestyle changes.
Whether you have or have had the winter blues in the past, there are ways to boost your spirits when those long, dreary days of January creep up on you like an old friend you don\u2019t want to see again. Here are some ways to beat those pesky winter blues and get back to your happy self!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Exercise"),mdx("p",null,"Exercising in the winter months can be a tricky proposition. After all, who wants to go running outside in the freezing cold? Nobody, that\u2019s who. But luckily, there are plenty of ways to get your exercise on inside, no matter how cold it gets outside."),mdx("p",null,"From yoga to Zumba, there are so many ways to exercise indoors and reap all the health and mood benefits that come with it. Even if you\u2019re not particularly into group exercise, you can always try out some simple at-home workouts! And don\u2019t worry about not getting enough light when you exercise indoors. A study conducted by Harvard Medical School found that 30 minutes of bright light is equivalent to 60 minutes of regular light. So, you\u2019ll still get plenty of light even when you\u2019re in the comfort of your own home!"),mdx("h2",null,"Light Therapy"),mdx("p",null,"Light therapy is a great way to treat the winter blues. Also known as phototherapy, light therapy uses bright light therapy to treat seasonal affective disorder. You can find light therapy lamps in many health and beauty stores. When using a light therapy lamp, be sure to follow the manufacturer\u2019s instructions."),mdx("p",null,"When choosing a light therapy lamp, look for one that has 10,000 lumens and a wavelength of either blue or white light. You\u2019ll also want to consider the size and price of the lamp. Other light therapy products include light boxes, visors, and blankets. These products deliver light directly to your eyes."),mdx("p",null,"Light therapy can help improve your mood and energy levels by increasing serotonin and dopamine levels in your brain."),mdx("h2",null,"Eat Well"),mdx("p",null,"As with most health issues, the best way to beat the winter blues is to eat well. You\u2019ve probably heard this one before, but it\u2019s true! Eating a balanced diet high in fruits and vegetables will help to boost your mood, energy levels, and immune system. A healthy diet should consist of about 50% fruits and vegetables, 25% whole grains, and 25% lean proteins."),mdx("p",null,"You don\u2019t have to go all-out healthy if you don\u2019t want to, but try to keep your diet balanced. Healthy foods can help to raise your serotonin levels, which will make you feel happier and more positive. Junk food, on the other hand, is full of chemicals that can actually lower your serotonin levels, making you feel more depressed."),mdx("h2",null,"Take Care of Yourself"),mdx("p",null,"When you\u2019re not taking care of yourself, it\u2019s easy to get caught up in the winter blues. But you don\u2019t have to let the winter weather get the best of you! Try to stay as active as you can, even if it means squeezing in shorter workouts."),mdx("p",null,"Make sure to get plenty of sleep, too. Getting enough sleep will help your body to repair and rejuvenate after all that cold weather stress. It will also help to lower your stress levels, which will make you feel a lot happier in general."),mdx("p",null,"You can take other steps to take care of yourself, too! Take time to meditate, book a massage, or find other ways to relax and destress."),mdx("h2",null,"Surround Yourself With Friends"),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re feeling the winter blues coming on, try to surround yourself with friends as much as possible. Get together with old friends, meet up with new friends, or even take a trip somewhere to visit friends you haven\u2019t seen in a while. Being around people you love and care about will help to boost your mood and increase your happiness levels. Not to mention, getting out of the house will make you feel less trapped as winter comes creeping in."),mdx("p",null,"You can also try to find new ways to connect with friends in your area. Try joining a club, taking an interesting class, or making plans to attend an event with friends. This will help you to meet new people while also keeping in touch with old friends!"),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"The winter blues can be a drag, but not if you know how to beat it. In order to beat these pesky winter blues, you\u2019ll need to exercise, eat well, take care of yourself, and surround yourself with friends. The best way to do that is to pick one or more of these activities and do them every day!"),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019ve been feeling blue during the winter months, don\u2019t worry: you aren\u2019t alone. Winter blues are common among many people, and there\u2019s a way to beat them. Follow these tips, and you\u2019ll be feeling back to your happy self in no time!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog Not to Chew on Household Items

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you ready to give up chewing on household objects? How about your dog? Dogs love to chew. It\u2019s something that comes naturally for them, and there are many things you can buy or make that will help satisfy their natural instincts to chew. But as much as dogs love to have objects that they can gnaw on, it\u2019s not always safe \u2013 or advisable \u2013 to let them do it in the home. There are plenty of household items that dogs shouldn\u2019t be allowed to chew, because it could lead to potential hazards or unsanitary conditions.
Even if your dog has never chewed on inappropriate things before, a new puppy will almost certainly try out things beyond what is safe for him. How you train him from the very beginning will determine how much damage he can do if he goes after something he shouldn\u2019t. So read on and learn how to stop your dog from chewing on anything other than his own toys.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...n}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...n,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a win-win proposition for businesses. It\u2019s an impartial and confidential process that helps individuals, businesses, and organizations reach mutually beneficial solutions to their conflicts. These solutions are usually in the form of agreements called \u201Cmediation agreements\u201D or \u201Ccollaborative mediation agreements.\u201D Mediation is not a one-time event but rather an ongoing process and collaboration between the disputants that involves multiple sessions.
Mediation can be used in all kinds of relationships where there is an opportunity to explore different ways of dealing with conflict and find win-win solutions without having to go to court or some other expensive third party adjudication. These include disputes between partners, shareholders, suppliers, customers, tenants, employees, suppliers and competitors; labor/management; landlord/tenant; divorcing spouses; members of nonprofit boards; roommates; feuding neighbours; business partners (and service providers); vendors (and clients); owners and real estate developers; executors and beneficiaries of trusts; owners and local governments etc.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Why There Is No Gender Wage Gap
How to Resolve Conflicts through Mediation

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a process in which an impartial third party helps two people resolve their differences and reach an equitable solution to their conflict. The mediator doesn\u2019t take sides, but instead helps both parties understand each other\u2019s point of view. This way, the disputants can agree on a fair outcome and put an end to their disagreements.
If you are part of an organization that is going through a lot of conflict right now (or any time soon), mediation might be a good solution for reducing tensions, smoothing things over and getting everyone back on track. Here we\u2019ll explain what mediation is, why it works so well for resolving conflicts and how you can initiate it in your organization.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Make Your Mornings Easier

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`You know those people who seem to get out of bed with ease every morning? You know, the people that you see on Instagram and wonder how they\u2019re so happy so early in the day? Well, we hate to break it to you but those people have their own set of problems. Getting up after a long night is hard for them too; the only difference is that their solutions work.
These people have their own rituals and habits when it comes to waking up in the morning. If these folks can do it then why can\u2019t we? It\u2019s because some of us are too comfortable, which means we need to shake things up! Do you want to be one of those people who gets out of bed with ease and has a productive day ahead of them? In this blog post, we\u2019ll tell you 5 ways you can make your mornings easier.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog Not to Bark Excessively

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Dogs bark for a variety of reasons and in different situations. Some dogs seem to bark much more than others, leading some owners to wonder how to train your dog not to bark excessively. When your dog barks excessively or at the wrong times, it can be annoying for you and other members of your household. You might find it difficult to get restful sleep when your dog won\u2019t stop barking or cries whenever you leave the house.
There are many reasons why dogs bark, but one thing is certain \u2013 excessive barking can be annoying and stressful for both dogs and their owners. Fortunately, there are ways to train your dog not to bark so frequently and effectively. Read on to discover how you can curb your dog\u2019s excessive barking quickly and easily!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Go to Bed

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Dogs are energetic and inquisitive creatures. It\u2019s great that they want to explore the world around them and make new discoveries every day, but what isn\u2019t so great is when they keep you up at night with their shenanigans. Doggy antics like sneaking out of their kennel, chewing on shoes, digging through the trash, or getting into a fight with another dog are all signs that your pup needs more structured activities. They may be natural predators who thrive on action and excitement, but dogs also need rest to maintain their mental and physical health.
If you want to give your dog a happy and healthy life, teaching them to go to bed is an excellent first step. All dogs have instincts which tell them when it\u2019s time to rest and regenerate energy for another day out in the wild. But domesticated dogs have lost some of these instincts as a result of living in human company. Fortunately, training your dog to go to bed is fairly easy with some dedication from you!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Mediation is a process that helps people resolve conflicts and find solutions to difficult problems. It\u2019t not the same thing as arbitration or negotiation. Mediation is a voluntary process in which a neutral third party, the mediator, assists others in exploring issues, managing conflict, and solving problems in an effort to resolve conflict and move forward. The parties involved in the dispute remain control over their own destiny at all times. They are free to walk away from mediation at any time with no consequence. The goal of mediation is not compromise but resolution. It\u2019t win-win or lose-lose but instead find a place somewhere between those two extremes where both parties can feel satisfied with the outcome of their dispute.  Mediation services are often provided by private organizations such as nonprofit community mediation centers or faith-based centers that offer these services pro bono publico, which means \u201Cfor the good of the public\u201D without charge."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Funniest Cat Videos on Youtube

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Why do crazy cat people love their cats so much? Because their cats are hilarious. With their constant sneering and condescending glares, feline friends have a knack for being entertaining in the most ridiculous ways. So, if you need a break from those stressful final exam cram sessions, we've compiled a list of the top 10 funniest cat videos on YouTube. From silly cats to crafty cats and everything in between, these videos will give you some much-needed LOLs.
Cat videos are one of the most popular video niches online today. There are several channels on YouTube that are dedicated only to cat videos and nothing else. In this post we\u2019ll look at some of the best channels that feature nothing but cat content \u2013 be it funny cat vines or cute cat compilations \u2013 as well as some of our favorite individual clips from these creators.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
